subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Friday, 25 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Houllier steps down as Lyon coach
Lyon coach Gerard Houllier parts company with the French champions.



 
McClaren tight-lipped on Beckham
England coach Steve McClaren refuses to play down growing speculation David Beckham will win an international recall.



 
O'Connor returns to Scots squad
Garry O'Connor is back in the Scotland set-up for the first time since going missing ahead of October's visit to Ukraine.








GOLF




PGA Championship leaderboard
Justin Rose continues his challenge at the PGA Championship at Wentworth.



 
Golf plans drug testing for 2008
The European Tour and other major international circuits intend to introduce anti-doping laws next year.



 
Rose & Broadhurst share PGA lead
Paul Broadhurst and Justin Rose share the clubhouse lead at the PGA Championship at Wentworth at six under.








MOTORSPORT




Button laughs off Honda exit talk
Jenson Button says reports he could leave Honda at the end of the season are "totally confusing".



 
Hamilton unhurt in Monaco crash
Lewis Hamilton crashes in practice for the Monaco Grand Prix as McLaren team-mate Fernando Alonso sets the pace.



 
Toseland - I can keep up momentum
James Toseland tells BBC Sport he is ready to kick on and win a second World Superbikes crown, starting this weekend at Silverstone.








FORMULA ONE




Button laughs off Honda exit talk
Jenson Button says reports he could leave Honda at the end of the season are "totally confusing".



 
Hamilton unhurt in Monaco crash
Lewis Hamilton crashes in practice for the Monaco Grand Prix as McLaren team-mate Fernando Alonso sets the pace.



 
Lauda 'stunned' by Hamilton start
Triple world champion Niki Lauda says Lewis Hamilton has impressed him more than any other rookie driver he has seen.








ATHLETICS




Benjamin ready to launch comeback
British 400m runner Tim Benjamin is targeting a return to his best form under new coach Colin Jackson.



 
Kenyan trio to miss World Champs
World record holder Paul Tergat is one of three Kenyan marathon stars unavailable for August's World Championships in Osaka.



 
Pavey races to Manchester victory
Britain's Jo Pavey produces a world-class performance to win the Great Manchester Run.








CYCLING




Riis confesses to doping offences
Former Tour de France winner Bjarne Riis admits using the banned blood-booster EPO during his career.



 
Zabel admits to doping at Telekom
German cyclist Erik Zabel becomes the latest cyclist to admit to using banned blood booster EPO while competing for Telekom in the 1990s.



 
Luca regains Giro d'Italia lead
Italy's Danilo di Luca wins the 12th stage of the Giro d'Italia to take the overall leader's pink jersey.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Graham Poll gets his air guitar out as the Liverpool parade bus stays in the garage



 
Farewell West Jesmond
BBC Sport's adopted team look back on their season



 
Quotes of the Week
Lawro says what he thinks about the FA Cup final, plus Mourinho & Warnock
